reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were directed to the Villa Rosa as the hotel "of choice" for a wedding, so did not do a lot of research. The greeting upon our arrival was cursory with no help offered to carry our bags up very steep steps to the first floor. We knew there was a problem when we saw the electric fan turning in front of the French doors that opened to a small balcony facing the small pool.
reviews.title: Fix the Plumbing from the 1940's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was so high that one needed to take a running leap to "mount" it. The sink, in the room, was pure 1940's replete with taps that turned the wrong way.
reviews.title: Fabulous!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife was unable to get enough hot water at high enough pressure to rinse the shampoo out of her hair. When we called the front desk, we learned that the " ... handyman had gone for the day ... . It was 5:45 PM on a Friday night; the hotel was fully booked. The hot water never came with enough pressure to take a descent shower.
reviews.title: Our Romantic Getaway

likes.liked: — The patio with the ocean/mountain view - the privacy, the company
likes.disliked: — Could use a little sprucing up - a a little remodeling, but quite charming the way it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The same was true on Saturday and again on Sunday. Upon checking out, I asked for an inconvenience discount. Julia, apparently, the owner, told me that she " ... was not authorized ..." to grant a discount. (The room was over $300/night.)
reviews.title: A disappointing visit
Thin Walls
reviews.text: While the hotel lobby is charming, it is not $300+ per night charming. Find a newer or remodeled hotel with plumbing that works!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've read the other reviews and it seems almost all are true - it just depends on what your expectations are and what you are used to/willing to accept.
reviews.title: Great location, clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BTW, I stayed in room 5, which was at the end of the hall, downstairs next to the exit door. My room-specific comments apply to this room only.
reviews.title: NIce Relaxed Feel, location A++

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good points
reviews.title: Pleasant, Affordable stay at the Villa Rosa

likes.liked: — Price, location, free wine and cheese, free breakfast, free tea and cookies 24/7.
likes.disliked: — Dark room, no a/c, occasional musty smell.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: It's located within a few minutes walk of Stearns Wharf, the train station, and car rental agencies. It's also close to State St. but you'd have to walk for about 15 minutes to get to the hopping part of downtown. (Note: If you travel by train, I'd walk from the station to the hotel and rent a car when needed)
reviews.title: Awful... Just Awful!!!

reviews.text: Cleanliness: The housekeepers came every day and restocked the toiletries.
reviews.title: Could use some sprucing up, but OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Inn could be a "stellar" little inn. The "bones" as they say were beautiful, but the quality of the rooms and ammenities was very poor. In Room 17 the bed is so far off the ground I had to have help getting into it and so hard I slept on the bolster pillows. This was Valentines week end and we checked out after one night. I would LOVE to see some love and work spent on this place...all the basics are there in abundance......just no love and care. We visit Santa Barbara several times a year as it's our place......we will not stay here again. PS The staff was delightful and helpful.
reviews.title: Good Bones - Poor Quality

reviews.text: The staff were incredible helpful and friendly. We arrived very late but that didn't cause any problems. The rooms need a bit of modernising but there was nothing uncomfortably poor.
reviews.title: Very friendly staff

reviews.text: Breakfast was pleasant and there was plenty of food. Having a glass of wine and some cheese every evening was delightfully decadent, sitting by the fire. It is within easy reach of the city centre and the beach.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this place for the free internet and toasted waffles, and I hope I can stay here the next time I visit Santa Barbara. Marvellous!
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used to stay at this Inn years ago; this was our first time back in some time. We were very disappointed in what the new owners have done, or have NOT done. The ceiling light fixture in our room was falling, one of the electrical outlets was so loose I was very hesitant to plug my phone charger in it. The bath/shower/toilet area was so small I had to come out into the room to dry off. Our sheets were changed for our second nights stay, they were old and the elastic was stretched, the sheet kept coming off of the corner of the mattress I just gave up and slept on the wad of sheet. The staff is pleasant and the afternoon wine and cheese was good as was the breakfast. That will be my last stay.
reviews.title: Spend the extra $$!

reviews.text: this hotel was very disappointing! it's an older, musty building with thin walls and very loud neighbors. when we checked in, we were told there was no room available for us, and we'd have to stay at the next door "sister hotel" (which is a motel). then somehow they found a room for us, but they were unable to meet our requests (room on the first floor because there is no elevator, and an extra cot because there are no rooms with two beds). it was very difficult for a disabled person to walk up and down the stairs and made the whole vacation much more difficult. we found our room to be musty and it did not have air conditioner as we were told. then starting at 7am on sunday morning, there was loud music from the church next door, as well as door slamming from the cleaning staff. it was very difficult to get a good night's sleep. i would not recommend this hotel to anybody considering they were unacommodating, the room was old, loud and musty, and it cost us $300 a night.
reviews.title: very disappointed

likes.disliked: — terrible service, old dirty building, little parking, loud neighbors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, the website alludes that the Inn faces the water. It does not, in fact most rooms do not have ocean views, unless you count hanging over you balcony and crooking you neck to see the ocean.
reviews.title: Just like grandma's house
Old and Musty
reviews.text: That being said, the old place really really could use updating. I'm not talking Four Season renovation, just economical updates like, replacing grandma's flowery duvet and sheets from 1940, ripping out the stained green carpet and maybe giving the couch/chair/coffee tables a quick sand/stain job. Also, updating the amenities, such as shampoo/lotion/condition and giving out more than one tiny bar of glycerin soap wouldn't hurt. PS, we stayed in room 15

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I realize that for Santa Barbara $300/night is standard, but really, the website makes the Inn sound a lot better than it
reviews.title: THIS PLACE IS AWFUL!

reviews.text: What's nice about Inn is the location; right off State street and very close to the beach/piers. Also, they have a delightful courtyard with great greenery and a nice evening wine reception and a small continental bkfst every morning; they even have carafes you can bring back to your room.
reviews.title: Quaint, nice ambience, pleasant, a bit pricey
